title: Meaning of definite integral in context

content.question: The temperature in a room at midnight is 20 degrees Celsius. Over the next 24 hours, the temperature changes at a rate modeled by the differentiable function H, where H(t) is measured in degrees Celsius per hour and time t is measured in hours since midnight. Which of the following is the best interpretation of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mn>6</mn> </msubsup> <mtext> </mtext> </mrow> </mstyle><mi>H</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo></mrow><mtext> </mtext><mi>d</mi><mi>t</mi></mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbiqaaWKgqaaaaa aaaaWdbmaapedapaqaaiaaysW7aSqaa8qacaaIWaaapaqaa8qacaaI 2aaaniabgUIiYdGccaWGibWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadshaaiaawIcaca GLPaaapaGaaGjbV=qacaWGKbGaamiDaaaa@42F3@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> ?

choices.label: The temperature of the room, in degrees Celsius, at 6:00 A.M.
The average temperature of the room, in degrees Celsius, between midnight and 6:00 A.M.
The change in the temperature of the room, in degrees Celsius, between midnight and 6:00 A.M.
The rate at which the temperature in the room is changing, in degrees Celsius per hour, at 6:00 A.M.

content.answer: The change in the temperature of the room, in degrees Celsius, between midnight and 6:00 A.M.

topic.text: 8.3: Using Accumulation Functions and Definite Integrals in Applied Contexts

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
